javelin.model.world

Class WorldActor

  • java.lang.Object
    • javelin.model.world.WorldActor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Caravan, Incursion, Location, ParkedVehicle, Squad

    public abstract class WorldActor
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    An independent overworld feature. If you're creating a new actor type don't forget to update WorldActor#getallmapactors()!
    Author:
    alex
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • remove

        public void remove()
        Definitely removes this actor from the game.

      • place

        public void place()
        Adds this actor to the game. Should only be used once in theory.

      • createvisual

        public tyrant.mikera.engine.Thing createvisual()
        TODO remove on 2.0+

      • move

        public void move(int tox,
                 int toy)
        Move actor to the given coordinates.

      • destroy

        public abstract java.lang.Boolean destroy(Incursion attacker)
        Called when an incursion reaches this actor's location.
        Parameters:
        incursion - Attacking incursion.
        Returns:
        true if this place gets destroyed, false if the Incursion is destroyed or null if neither.
        See Also:
        Incursion#ignoreincursion(Incursion), Incursion.fight(int, int)

      • displace

        public void displace()
        Moves actor to nearby square until a free square is found.

      • turn

        public void turn(long time,
                 WorldScreen world)
        Called on each instance once per day.
        Parameters:
        time - Current hour, starting from hour zero at the beggining of the game.

      • interact

        public boolean interact()
        Called when a Squad enters the same world square as this actor.
        Returns:
        true if the World should react after this interaction.
        Throws:
        RepeatTurn

      • setlocation

        public void setlocation(int x,
                        int y)
        Note that this doesn't place() or update the actor in any way.
        Parameters:
        x - World coordinate.
        y - World coordinate.

      • distance

        public double distance(int xp,
                       int yp)
        Returns:
        Distance from this actor to the given coordinates.

      • get

        public static WorldActor get(int x,
                             int y,
                             java.lang.Class<? extends WorldActor> type)
        Returns:
        Actor of the given type that occupies the given coordinates, or null.

      • get

        public static WorldActor get(int x,
                             int y)
        Returns:
        Any actor on these coordinates.

      • get

        public static WorldActor get(int x,
                             int y,
                             java.util.List<? extends WorldActor> actors)
        Returns:
        Actor of the given set that occupies these coordinates.

      • getall

        public static java.util.ArrayList<WorldActor> getall()
        Returns:
        A new list with all existing WorldActors.

      • getall

        public static java.util.ArrayList<WorldActor> getall(java.lang.Class<? extends WorldActor> type)
        Note that this returns the canonical list from INSTANCES.
        Returns:
        All actors of the given type.
